Package it.unipd.dei.webapp.wacar.rest

Class AbstractRR

java.lang.Object
it.unipd.dei.webapp.wacar.rest.AbstractRR
All Implemented Interfaces:
RestResource
Direct Known Subclasses:
GetOrderByIdAndUserEmailRR, InsertOrderRR, ListCarsRR, ListCircuitsRR
public abstract class AbstractRR extends Object implements RestResource
Represents a generic REST resource.
Since:
1.00
Version:
1.00
Author:
Manuel Rigobello (manuel.rigobello@studenti.unipd.it)

    • AbstractRR

      protected AbstractRR(String action, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res, Connection con)
      Creates a new REST resource.
      Parameters:
      action - the action performed by this REST resource.
      req - the HTTP request.
      res - the HTTP response.
      con - the connection to the database.

  • Method Details

    • serve

      public void serve() throws IOException
      Serves the REST request. Checks if the request method and/or MIME media type are allowed, and if not, returns without further processing. The appropriate error message is sent by the checkMethodMediaType method. If processing the request encounters an exception, an error message is logged, and a corresponding error message JSON response is sent. Finally, removes action and resource log contexts.
      Specified by:
      serve in interface RestResource
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while serving the REST request.

    • doServe

      protected abstract void doServe() throws IOException
      Performs the actual logic needed for serving the REST request.

      Subclasses have to implement this method in order to define the actual strategy for serving the REST request.

      Throws:
      IOException - if any error occurs in the client/server communication.

    • checkMethodMediaType

      protected boolean checkMethodMediaType(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res) throws IOException
      Checks that the request method and MIME media type are allowed.

      Subclasses may override it to customize their behaviour, e.g. not limiting the MIME media types to JSON.

      Parameters:
      req - the HTTP request.
      res - the HTTP response.
      Returns:
      true if the request method and the MIME type are allowed; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if any error occurs in the client/server communication.

    • checkIsLoggedIn

      protected boolean checkIsLoggedIn(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse res) throws IOException
      Checks that the user is logged in to perform the operation.
      Parameters:
      req - the HTTP request.
      res - the HTTP response.
      Returns:
      true if the user type can access to the resource; false otherwise.
      Throws:
      IOException - if any error occurs in the client/server communication.
